author: erol312006
title: boring set
review:
there is really nothing great about this set     
     the droid commander has 2 yellow dots ,,,  so you have to buy it to complete your lego star wars collection...
        i mean lego come on ...   i could think of many other great sets to put together not another  droid tri fighter

author: mcicero7
title: Dog Fighting... in Space!
review:
Lego has done a good job of producing Star Wars fighters for clones and Jedi but absent an enemy it limits the possibilities. Other droid fighters have come paired with a Jedi ship which makes building an enemy fleet even harder.

Now we have a re-issue of set 7252 and it is a huge improvement.

The tri-wing setup is constructed from a series of hinged pieces with flat panels serving as places for stickers and adding a blue/black color scheme. The design is ingenious and simple with great looking results.

The cockpit couldn't get any simpler and as a result there is no way to position a droid pilot creating the biggest drawback, the bouncing pilot. The set is solid when built and holds up very well when being handled.

The engines are simple and with some minor additions could be greatly improved. The firing missiles are nicely done and the blasters look good.

The presence of three droids adds a little something extra.

All in all a nice upgrade from the previous version and a welcome addition to the fleet.

author: captain_radda_radda
title: A massive improvement
review:
5 years after the origanal tri-fighter, lego decides to re-do one of the least favorite vehicles. I want to start off by saying that this set is BIG. Its overall size has almost doubled when compared to the origanal. It is about as long as the Republic Fighter Tank. The colors are also great with many dark blues and light grays around the ship. Unfortunately, there are quite a few stickers. I dont mind them, its just that on a set like this, putting them on wrong can be disasterous. One of the best freatures that we see is the torpedoes. These things are huge! Although the cockpit is completely open, I think its sole purpose is to add detail. For those of you who have Buzz Droids, try fitting them in the cockpit to save room and make space . The rocket droids are cool and the commander is a nice change. Clearly, the marks are hand painted, because they are uneven and somewhat messy. It okay though, at least Lego didn't completely nuke the idea of single marks. 

Pros:
Large
The minifigures
The colors
The torpedoes
The build

Cons
The paint on the commander
No use for the cockpit

Overall:
One of the best re-dos in a while. The price is fair considering its size and piece count. Its nice to see Lego slowly straying away from the clone wars and making more OT and PT sets. Either way though, I hope they keep making more Ep. 3 sets as 2010 is the 5th aniversery.

author: shiloa437
title: Must be brothers with the tie defender
review: I do not own this set but me and my freind built it together and i have to say, its pretty big for its price and way bigger than the old one about twice as big and the new rocket battle droid commander is a nice addition to the set but it would be nice if they put those markings on the other droid commander's rather than the completely yellow body :-/ thats why i like teh old ones anyhow this set is awesome except building experience is repetetively lame and it could include at least a buzz droid or 2...So anyhow if you see this set and are prepared for building the same thing three times get this set.

author: Hylocera
title: What's with the cockpit?
review:
As I said in the title, WHAT IS WITH THE COCKPIT??? I have never seen a droid piloting a Tri-Fighter in Episode III. Maybe in the Clone Wars, yes, that would explain the Rocket Droids. Besides that, I know LEGO couldn't help it, but this set has a disastrously repetitive build. I did three at a time for the wing things.

PROS

  • New Rocket Commander Minifig
  • A ton of "security cameras" for building the wings
  • Cool cockpit elements
  • Nice color
  • Looks MUCH better than the 2005 release
  • Great playability
  • HUGE missiles

CONS

  • Kinda...small? Compared to the Typhoon Turbo Sub, this thing is a little on the tiny side (I have heard previous reviews commenting on its size... The TX-130S is that small??)
  • Cockpits break off when you attempt to open them, even when you are holding the joint things
  • Over- repetitive build
  • You have to flip the Tri-Fighter over to fire the missiles properly
  • Cockpit?? I guess it is useful when you are moving this thing around, though.
  • The 1x1 cylinders underneath the "wings" break off easily

Overall, if your looking for price, and not piece count, buy the Typhoon Turbo Sub. For a rare minifig, buy the Freeco Speeder. For a rare CREATURE, buy Echo Base.

author: NadiaA1858
title: Much better than Original
review:
I got this fighter today and it's a great fighter. It is very accurate to the movies, and the minifigs are great. I like that lego is finally coming back to painted battle droids. The commander is certainly one of the strong points of this set. The Rocket battle droids are cool too, but not as awesome. This set is also larger than I expected and is very detailed. I like that the bombs are not just a flick-fire with a cone on the front, they actually look like bombs. Lego put a lot of thought into this set and it is one of the better 2010 sets.

Pros:
Very detailed
Commander Droid
Rocket Droids
Nice bombs
Value for money
Looks great

Cons:
Repetitive build
Droid is loose in cockpit
A few more functions would be nice.

author: THX_1138
title: Excellent set, even better than the original
review:
When I saw the prelim pics, this was one of the sets I was least excited about. It look a little odd, and not any better than the first one. However, as I saw more pictures of it, I began to like it. Although I don't have all the 2010 sets yet, this is my favorite so far, and the price is probably the best deal in terms of the ship itself, as opposed to minifigs that come with it.

  • Pros:
  • Excellent looking
  • Very reasonable price
  • While nothing too special, the rocket droid commander is a nice touch that separates it from the other rocket droids
  • The flick-fire missiles don't get in the way of the rest of the set
  • There aren't all that many stickers, and if you don't apply them, it would't hurt the model as badly as some (Freeco speeder)

  • Cons:
  • There are red tips on the guns, but they are easily removed
  • There are only two 'eyes' on the front, the bottom one is missing
  • The sides of the arms around the center have some holes in them, but if you add more 2x4 wing plates, this can be fixed
This is a very good set, for which I have no large complaints. A must buy for anyone who likes the PT or CW.

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: Better than the older tri-fighter
review:
The Droid Tri-Fighter  set (8086) is a LEGO Star Wars set which came out in 2010. It comes with 3 minifigures and 268 pieces. This set does include decals.

Minifigures:

  • Rocket battle droid: The rocket battle droids look awsome. They have orange battle droid torsos and heads. The jetpacks are made out of binoculars.
  • Rocket battle droid commander: The rocket battle droid commanders are same as the rocket battle droids. The only difference is the yellow printing on this head
Tri-Fighter:

  • The tri-fighter has a cockpit which swivels open. It's more sturdy than in the tri-fighter set from 2005. The 2010 version is much bigger and much longer than the one 2005 version. The 2010 droid tri-fighter also comes with 2 big flick-missles and lots of lasers.

Positive:

  • Minifigures
  • New rocket battle droid commander
  • Pieces for brickfilms and stopmotions
  • Great army builder

Negative:

  • Stickers
  • Price

All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on LEGO Shop@Home, eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure.

Videos I made of this set:

Review: http://www.youtube.com/user/KLOKRIECHER#p/search/1/kSRMZUdYdB4

Stopmotion: http://www.youtube.com/user/KLOKRIECHER#p/search/0/7vzem70ma2M

author: stormtrooper321
title: The Droid Tri-Fighter is Awesome!
review: The blaster cannon and flick bomb-equipped droid tri-fighter and its rocket-powered battle droids escorts are ready to unleash their firepower on the Republic forces. More agile and better armed than standard vulture droids, these Separatist fighters are a threat to any Republic starfighter! Includes two rocket battle droids and one rocket battle droid commander minifigure.

author: legoDad42
title: NICELY DESIGNED...but flawed.
review:
The Droid Tri-Fighter is a nicely designed ship which looks great at all angles and comes with 3 Rocket-Battle Droids. Plus, it's a great value for your money piece wise (268 parts for $25.00us).

 

PRO's...

  • Overall design of the vehicle. Looks great at any angle (front/side/back/top/bottom very well designed and sleek look).
  • Open/close bubble cockpit.
  • Laser cannons mounted top, left, right and centered.
  • Rear engine well designed (3 thrusters).
  • 2 long Rocket, flick-fire missiles underneath.
  • 3 Rocket-Battle Droids with jetpacks (binocular pieces)...1 Rocket-Droid Commander with yellow crown and yellow stripe on front of body and 2 regular Rocket Battle Droids (all come with standard issue rifles).
  • Build is nice with gives ideas for bending sections and engine designs.

CON's...

  • Flawed cockpit. When opening the bubble halves, it pulls off the brick plate with hinge constantly. Not good for kids playability if they're taking out a battle droid pilot often.
  • Even when securing back that plate, the clutch is off so when you close the bubble, it leaves a slight space/opening.
  • No real seated area for pilot in bubble cockpit. Just sits in there loose. They should've thought this out more.
  • Centered bubble should have the 'brain' of the ship instead of putting in a Rocket Battle Droid.
  • No Buzz-Droids.

 

 

Overall it's a model I like because of the design. Playbility for older kids is fine, since you can secure the cockpit back no problem but for younger kids I suggest leaving the cockpit unmaned and closed so kid's won't have frustration when playing. Of note though, for the younger kid builder, they should have no problem putting this together with just some help from parents bending the sections to make the curved shape(the bracing arms). Also parents, make sure that first part of the build with the 3 pronged plate is lined up properly. Double check that first step for your kids.

 

I recommend this model for it's overall design for the AFoL and TFoL and it's an easy kit for kid's and parents to put together and play with but bear in mind the separation of the bubble cockpit when putting any pilot mini-fig.

author: benjadude11
title: Orange... Love it!
review:
I got this set today at Target because I needed something to complement my recently rebuilt VI-9 Torrent. I basically made a good choice. Here are some pros and cons:
Pros:
  • The orange battle droids are really nice. The color is deep and rich and goes well with the ship's blue color.
  • The set comes with two bubble cockpit pieces that I am drooling over. I can't wait to use them in some MOC's.
  • There are two relatively concealed flick-fire missiles that are extra long. They look excellent.
  • It's heftier than the old droid tri-fighter and is sturdier, too.
  • It comes with twelve, yes you heard me twelve, of the new two-by-four smooth pieces. :D
Cons:
  • The cockpit is as lame as the last tri-fighter was. There are no seats, so the droid just rattles around inside while the thing flies.
  • The nose gun comes off really easily.
  • The playability is terrible unless you already have something for it to fight against. (VI-9 Torrent or ARC-170 Starfighter, for example.) There is no one included in the set for it to fight. 
  • It's sturdier than the model from '05, yes, but that doesn't mean it's indestructible. The curved blue arches that make up most of the ship tend to compress in near the cockpit, and they take a while to undo.
Overall:
This is a good set if you: a) have something for it to fight against, b) if you are as avid a MOCer as me, or c) you are all of the above. If this does not apply to you, save your dough for Prince of Persia.

author: Yankeesboy08
title: Awesome set
review: First off, this set is much better than the original. The minifigures are awesome especially the rocket droid commander. The only problem is that the cockpit keeps falling off. Also, I hate having to build 3 of everything. I wish it came with a buzz droid to put inside the cockpit. This set is fun to play with if you got the new arc 170 fighter. I also noticed that the missiles on the bottom are a little too big and don`t look the best with the set. Overall the set is fun to play with, is worth the $20.00, and contains great figures. I would give this set 5/5.

author: Firox_5000
title: A nice but average set
review:
I got this from lego shop for £24.99.

 

The set includes three rocket battle droids. Although roughly the same as those in the Hyena droid bomber one of them has yellow print on the top of his head who I think is a droid commander. 

 

The main and only ship included in the ship is the Tri fighter itself. Comparing it to the 2005 version it is much bette. it is bigger,stronger and more broader. The set is very nice and goes well with many sets including the arc-170 and V-19 torrent.

 

The only cons are the pod where the droids sit and fly the fighter is flimsy and breaks quite easily. The sides of the fighter also sometimes have a couple of pieces breaking off which can be quite hard sometimes to repair. I also think they should have included  at least 1  buzz droid  and two battle droids instead of three.

 

Comparing it price wise to the 2005 version the original was £9.99. Keeping in mind this set is bigger and that costs have gone up since I think £24.99 is a bit steep really and although it's piece count is quite high at 268 pieces it's too small really for a £25 set. I think the set should have been priced at £20 as it is far more reasonable and tolerable with nowaday star wars prices which sets which have been released after this in the theme have had far worser value for money.

 

I recomend this set to star wars fans but not for £25 , Try and get it for £20 or less if you can.

author: Probert
title: Intricate build, well thought out by designer.  Cockpit tends to pop off when you add crew.
review:
Intricate build.  Cockpit tends to fall out of place when it is opened to put a crewbot inside.  Designer thought this one out well.

 

When you open the box it seems that there are not enough pieces to create the fighter.  But there are just lots of small and fairly unusual pieces that must be put together.  It is almost surprising when the build ends and you snap the wings together at the central axis.

 

Very fun.  My son loves the little jet-pack droids that are included. 

 

Also, was able to purchase set at target for about $5 less than the retail price.

author: Skyboss
title: It's a tri-fighter! look out!
review:
I bought this set along with Plo Koon's starfighter. This set is like the one from 2005.
"Like" is a key word here. It is a little longer and has a fighter/bomber look. In place of the buzz droid there are three battle droids. One of them is a commander, and are like the ones from the henya droid bomber set.
Parts: this set is host to dark blue and black with light grey. Fairly rare light grey "Motor" parts and printed bricks. 
Minifigures: The rocket battle driods are a new Lego idea. These droids are featured in season one of "Star Wars The clone wars". I have yet to see the commander rocket droid in any of the episodes, but season three is coming soon.
The build: fairly mistake or confusion free, but look out for thinking on autopilot. This will make mistakes.
Overall: this set is nice and is good for those who don't own the one from 2005. This set is nice for dogfights with other sets you own. Pick it up when you see it, but it will possibly be around for a while.

author: LEGOSLUG
title: Blast the Jedi out of the Sky!
review:
Here is my review of the LEGO Star Wars set 8086: Droid Tri-Fighter.

The Minifigures:


There are three minifigures included in this set, all of them being Battle Droids, but these ones are slightly different to the standard version. The Rocket Battle Droids X2 and Rocket Battle Droid Commander: These two battle droids are different in 3 ways to the standard version.

 

* The droid is 2 different colours: Maroonish red, and Gray.

* The Torso is red, the arms and legs are Gray. 

* The droid has a Jetpack, which is made with and round little "dot" and binoculars.

 - The only difference between the Commander and the other two is that the commander has 2 patches of Yellow - On the "Head" and the Torso. -


The Build:

The build looks very simple, but do not be fooled! It is a very hard build, there are no mistakes in the instructions, but the steps are hard to understand- lots of 2x this and 3x that etc. There are HEAPS OF STICKERS. The finished set looks brilliant, but can be a bit fragile.

Now, on to the Pros and Cons.

Pros

* 3 Minifigures, Rare ones at that.

* Minifigures have Guns and each have a Jetpack.

* Minifigures can ALL fit in cockpit.

 

Cons

* A little weak.

* NO ONE TO FIGHT! 

* STICKERS

 

Overall it is a good set, lots of playability, suitable either for play or display. 5/5

 

LEGOSLUG

 

P.S.Please see and rate my other reviews and bricklists.

author: StratTone
title: Can't find any downsides.
review: On the box it looks like nothing to interesting until you build it.  They way they made the surrounding pylons was a great great idea!  Wish the cock-pit closed better but it is in no way a deal breaker!  Amazing set for the money!  Highly reccomend.

author: tkettle9719
title: Droid Vehicle in Space!
review:
I got this set from my grandparents for my birthday, and think that it is one of the best-designed and playable sets overall.

Pros

  • -The ship is very sleek and up-to-date.
  • -There are many play functions, such as missiles and a cockpit.
  • …

Cons

  • -Very repetitive build, for wings at least.
  • -The stickers of the Trade Federation have returned.
  • …

This set is excellent for play and display, and is a nice way to get minifigures in a cheap set. I highly recommend this set to all prequel trilogy fans.

author: joevans3
title: Great set, interesting build
review:
This is a great set with a really unique tri-fold build.  I used a couple of new pieces that I don't think I've built with before.  The wings are made of a bending series of triangular parts.

I would not recommend this for a young builder.  The instructions are clear, but might get frustrating.

author: tomalphin
title: Great ship around 250 pieces.  Curved shape sets it apart from the rest.
review:
About me: I am an AFOL who has built at least 1 set each year for my whole life, but have built a lot more this year. I usually build sets under 500 pieces as a "puzzle build", without using the instructions, but I used the instructions to build this quickly.

Initial Impressions: Interesting part selection but not a ton of variety.  The set includes 15+ of the same part, the reason for which will be immediately obvious once you start building.  I liked the dark blue color scheme - it is an attractive color which doesn't show up in many models I've built.

Building experience: I usually critique models with a lot of repetitive construction, but I found this to be fun due to the large curving sections and the interesting parts.  As I built the three identical curved sections, I started to wonder how it would come together in the end.

Finished model: It's a good looking model and I like to see sets which break away from the brick, showcasing curved shapes like this model.  It's way more interesting than your average 250pc set with two boring wings, a cockpit and only the unique color scheme or stickers sets it apart from every other ship.  A top-notch small set.

Conclusion: 8/10 on a 10 point scale.  This is a well above average build for the # of pieces.  Nice colors and interesting/unusual parts round out the set well.  (Naturally, this set isn't as "cool" as a 8/10 set with 2,000 pieces, but it is a great smaller set.)

Using the instructions, this model took 20 minutes to build.
